00001 """
00002 QSOS-Engine's splitter module.
00003 
00004 This module provides all required tools for splitting a raw QSOS-Evaluation into
00005 new qscores files, stored into the convenient folder of local repository copy.
00006 splitter
00007 """
00008 
00009 ##
00010 #    @defgroup splitter Splitter 
00011 #    @ingroup Engine
00012 #    @author Hery Randriamanamihaga
00013 
00014 
00015 
00016 
00017 from Engine import document
00018 from Engine import family
00019 from xml.dom import minidom
00020 import os
00021 
00022 
00023 ##
00024 #    @ingroup splitter
00025 #        
00026 def parse(evaluation,repositoryroot=".."):
00027     """
00028     Parses a qsos evaluation and creates/overwrite qscore files containing
00029     elements' scores and comments for each family declared in qsosappfamily
00030     evaluation's tag.
00031 
00032     The tree structure under sheet directory may also be modified as qscore
00033     files are created into appname/version directory. (appname and version are
00034     also extracted from evaluation's header)
00035     
00036     @param evaluation
00037             string of evaluation XML flow
00038     
00039     @param repositoryroot
00040             path to root of local copy of repository.
00041             Default value is ..
00042     """
00043     
00044     #Transform XML flow into document object
00045     document = createDocument(evaluation)
00046     
00047     #Create tree folder in filesystem
00048     #makedirs fails with OSError 17 whenever the directory to make
00049     #already exists. This specific error is excepted 
00050     path = os.path.join(repositoryroot,
00051                         "sheets",
00052                         "evaluations",
00053                         document["properties"]["qsosappname"],
00054                         document["properties"]["release"]
00055                         )
00056     try :
00057         os.makedirs(path)
00058     except OSError, error :
00059         if error[0] != 17 : raise OSError, error
00060     
00061     #As the folder is created, can be added into.
00062     for f in document.families :
00063         file = open(os.path.join(path,".".join([f,"qscore"])),'w')
00064         file.write(createScore(document[f]))
00065         file.close()
00066 ##
00067 #    @ingroup splitter
00068 #
00069 def createDocument(evaluation,familypath="../sheets/families"):
00070     """
00071     Creates a document object  from qsos raw evaluation. Relevant elements are
00072     extracted from families modelsheets (elements with sub-elements are skipped
00073     as they do not have any score nor comment tag) and their evaluations are
00074     extracted from the qsos evaluation. The authors and dates are the same
00075     (evaluation's in fact) for each family. Generic section of qsos evaluation
00076     is also added to families component of a document. 
00077     
00078     @param evaluation
00079             Qsos evaluation's string flow
00080     
00081     @param familypath
00082             Path to families model sheets.
00083             Default value is ../sheets/families
00084         
00085     @return
00086         Evaluation's representation's document object
00087     """
00088     rawDocument = minidom.parseString(evaluation)
00089     #Define the ID attribute of each element tag of the raw document
00090     for element in rawDocument.getElementsByTagName("element"):
00091         element.setIdAttribute("name")
00092         
00093     #Create the property list from the content of header.
00094     #the first, second and last tag of header are ignored
00095     #as they are not document properties but part of families contents
00096     header = rawDocument.firstChild.firstChild.childNodes
00097     properties = dict( [ (node.tagName,node.firstChild.data)
00098                         for node in header[2:-2] ]
00099                       )
00100     
00101     #Instantiate a QSOS-Document object initiated with the properties extracted
00102     #from XML evaluation and empty family dictionnary
00103     qsos = document.Document(properties,{})
00104     
00105     #Extract  relevant information from the raw evaluation:
00106     #    - authors
00107     #    - dates
00108     #    - families (generic section is manually as it appears in each evaluation
00109     
00110     # TODO : Each information should be probed in case no values are
00111     #         provided in the XML document
00112     
00113     authors = [(item.firstChild.firstChild.data, item.lastChild.firstChild.data)
00114                for item in header[0].childNodes]
00115     dates = (header[1].firstChild.firstChild.data, header[1].lastChild.firstChild.data)
00116     families = [node.firstChild.data for node in header[-1].childNodes]
00117     families.insert(0,"generic")
00118 
00119     #Build the Family object for each family component of the evaluation :
00120     #    - Extract from repository the family sheet (.qin files)
00121     #    - Read the scores and comments from evaluation
00122     #    - Update entry in family object
00123     for include in families :
00124         template = minidom.parse("/".join([familypath,".".join([include,"qin"])]))
00125         #Initiate the family object : 
00126         #    -same authors and dates for all families of the same evaluation
00127         #    -empty score and comments dictionnary
00128         f = family.family(authors, dates, {}, {})
00129         for element in template.getElementsByTagName("desc0"):
00130             name = element.parentNode.getAttribute("name")
00131             
00132             # TODO : use a logger for AttributeError exception^^
00133         
00134             try :
00135                 f.scores[name] = rawDocument.                                   \
00136                                     getElementById(name).                       \
00137                                     getElementsByTagName("score").              \
00138                                     item(0).firstChild.data
00139             except AttributeError :
00140                 print "No score found for element %s" % (name,)
00141                 pass    
00142             try :
00143                 f.comments[name] = rawDocument.                                 \
00144                                     getElementById(name).                       \
00145                                     getElementsByTagName("comment")             \
00146                                     .item(0).firstChild.data
00147             except AttributeError :
00148                 pass
00149                 print "No comment found for element %s" % (name,)
00150         #End of iteration, just add the family in document object
00151         qsos.families[include] = f
00152     return qsos
00153 
00154 ##
00155 #    @ingroup splitter
00156 #
00157 def createScore(family):
00158     """
00159     Creates the qscore XML document of family object evaluation content to be
00160     stored on the local copy of repository.
00161     
00162     @param family 
00163             The family object to be transformed
00164     
00165     @return
00166         XML formatted family's qscore sheet
00167     """
00168     
00169     #Create the return DOM and root element <qsosscore>
00170     document = minidom.Document()
00171     root = document.createElement("qsosscore")
00172     
00173     #Build header which contains only author and dates
00174     header = document.createElement("header")
00175     toplevel = document.createElement("authors")
00176     for author in family["authors"] :
00177         tag = document.createElement("author")
00178         leaf = document.createElement("name")
00179         leaf.appendChild(document.createTextNode(author[0]))
00180         tag.appendChild(leaf)
00181         leaf = document.createElement("email")
00182         leaf.appendChild(document.createTextNode(author[1]))
00183         tag.appendChild(leaf)
00184         toplevel.appendChild(tag)
00185     header.appendChild(toplevel)
00186     tag = document.createElement("dates")
00187     leaf = document.createElement("creation")
00188     leaf.appendChild(document.createTextNode(family["date.creation"]))
00189     tag.appendChild(leaf)
00190     leaf = document.createElement("validation")
00191     leaf.appendChild(document.createTextNode(family["date.validation"]))
00192     tag.appendChild(leaf)
00193     header.appendChild(tag)
00194     
00195     #Build score section
00196     #Local copies of family's attribute are made as destructive
00197     #iterator are used.
00198     section = document.createElement("scores")
00199     scores = family.scores.copy()
00200     comments = family.comments.copy()
00201     
00202     #Elements with score tags are generated first. Corresponding
00203     #comments are also added to elements tag (and removed from
00204     #comments dictionnary)
00205     while scores :
00206         (name,value) = scores.popitem()
00207         tag = document.createElement("element")
00208         tag.setAttribute("name", name)
00209         leaf = document.createElement("score")
00210         leaf.appendChild(document.createTextNode(value))
00211         tag.appendChild(leaf)
00212         if name in comments :
00213             leaf = document.createElement("comment")
00214             leaf.appendChild(document.createTextNode(comments.pop(name)))
00215             tag.appendChild(leaf)
00216         section.appendChild(tag)
00217     
00218     #Remaining items of comments dictionnary are added to output XML
00219     #No score tags for these elements as there must be no item left in scores 
00220     while comments :
00221         (name, value) = comments.popitem()
00222         tag = document.createElement("element")
00223         tag.setAttribute("name", name)
00224         leaf = document.createElement("comment")
00225         leaf.appendChild(document.createTextNode(value))
00226         tag.appendChild(leaf)
00227         section.appendChild(tag)
00228     
00229     #Build the final document
00230     root.appendChild(header)
00231     root.appendChild(section)
00232     document.appendChild(root)    
00233     
00234     #Pretty format ant return the result qsos score sheet
00235     return document.toprettyxml("\t", "\n", "utf-8")
